definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: Don't try to be a jack of all trades, become a master of one.
sentences.chinese: 不要想着成爲萬事通，去成爲某一樣事的專家。

sentences.english: Position yourself as the go-to person who knows the history of the company, customers, and business.
sentences.chinese: 成爲了解公司歷史，客戶，公司業務的萬事通。

sentences.english: I am not a man of hidden talents but I may be considered as a jack of all trades .
sentences.chinese: 我隨說不上是一個身懷絕技的人，但也算是個萬事通。
一個標準的瞎眼萬事通。

sentences.english: A T-shaped software developer is a jack-of-all-trades, but a master of one.
sentences.chinese: T形軟件開發者是萬事通，但是卻精於某一項技能。

sentences.english: Grace is always correcting other people. She thinks she’s a know-it-all.
sentences.chinese: 格雷斯總是在糾正別人，她覺得自己是萬事通。

definition: to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
hard to distinguish real from imitation

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
(coll.) (Tw) troublesome customer/obnoxious guest (from Taiwanese 漚客|沤客, Tai-lo pr. [àu-kheh])
